abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Maternal and Infant Health and Nutrition Project is to
            support the Government of Guatemala to a) improve maternal
            and infant health in the project's 40 areas of
            intervention; and b) reduce chronic malnutrition among
            children younger than two years of age in the rural areas of
            the 70 municipalities targeted by the project. This project
            paper includes: to introduce three changes in the project
            documents as follows: 1) extend the project closing date for
            five months from December 31, 2012 to May 30, 2013 to allow
            for the completion of critical activities; 2) reallocate
            funds among project disbursement categories; and 3) formally
            revise targets for eight indicators and description of two
            indicators, as well as include three intermediate results
            indicators in the results monitoring framework. These
            changes will i) allow the project to complete the few
            remaining activities which have been delayed as a result of
            changes in the Ministry of Health and related modifications
            in administrative and financial procedures; ii) reassign
            funds to take into account actual expenditures and the
            projects future needs; and iii) align certain targets with
            what can be realistically achieved based on implementation
            experience and prevailing country context, as well as adjust
            the description of two indicators: one to specify three
            programs referred to and the other in order to accurately
            reflect established reporting practice with World Bank, also
            include three core indicators in line with World Bank's
            health, nutrition, and population sector requirements.
